EdgeComparison.title: iBrowe vs Edge
EdgeComparison.subtitle: Microsoft Edge is the successor to Internet Explorer and is the world's third most used browser (and second on desktop). But this is mostly because it's the default browser on Windows devices. Few people choose to switch to Edge on their own. While Edge has some good features and is optimized for Windows, when it comes to privacy, performance, and important features, Edge is missing a lot. Let's compare them.
EdgeComparison.privacyTitle: Is iBrowe more private than Edge?
EdgeComparison.privacyDescription: Microsoft is an example of 'Big Tech' and one of the world's most valuable companies. While most of its profits come from selling PCs and software like Windows, advertising is also a massive revenue source. And those ads are mostly found in Edge (and the Bing search engine). Edge tracks you across the web and collects as much data as possible. Microsoft 'monetizes' this data in the form of highly targeted ads. For Microsoft, Edge is about advertising and profit. Meanwhile, iBrowe blocks almost all attempts to track you:
EdgeComparison.privacyConclusion: In short, Edge is built for tracking. It allows creepy ads, trackers, cookies, and more to follow you around the web, record everything you do, and link that activity directly to you. All without your knowledge or consent. Meanwhile, iBrowe is private by default.
EdgeComparison.featuresTitle: Does iBrowe have more features than Edge?
EdgeComparison.featuresDescription: Both iBrowe and Edge are built on the open-source Chromium browser engine (the same one used in other browsers like Chrome, Opera, and Vivaldi). So you can expect similar looks and functions. But when it comes to things beyond those similarities, iBrowe has many customizations that Edge can't compete with.
EdgeComparison.featuresComparison: Let's look at the comparison by quality of results and transparency:

DuckDuckGoComparison.title: iBrowe Search vs DuckDuckGo
DuckDuckGoComparison.subtitle: DuckDuckGo is a privacy-focused search engine that doesn't track its users. While this is a great start, iBrowe Search goes even further by providing a complete privacy solution that protects you across the entire web, not just during search.
DuckDuckGoComparison.privacyTitle: Is iBrowe Search more private than DuckDuckGo?
DuckDuckGoComparison.privacyDescription: DuckDuckGo has built its reputation on privacy, and it's true that they don't track your searches. However, their privacy protection is limited to the search experience itself. Once you click on a search result, you're on your own. iBrowe Search, on the other hand, provides comprehensive privacy protection:
DuckDuckGoComparison.privacyConclusion: While DuckDuckGo is a good choice for private search, iBrowe Search offers a more complete privacy solution that protects you not just during search, but across your entire browsing experience.
DuckDuckGoComparison.featuresTitle: Does iBrowe Search have more features than DuckDuckGo?
DuckDuckGoComparison.featuresDescription: Both iBrowe Search and DuckDuckGo prioritize privacy, but iBrowe Search offers additional features that enhance your browsing experience while maintaining privacy.

GoogleComparison.title: iBrowe Search vs Google
GoogleComparison.subtitle: Google is the world's most popular search engine, but it comes at a cost to your privacy. iBrowe Search offers a private alternative that doesn't track your searches or collect your personal data.
GoogleComparison.privacyTitle: Is iBrowe Search more private than Google?
GoogleComparison.privacyDescription: Google's business model is built on collecting and monetizing user data. Every search you make, every website you visit, and every click you make is tracked, analyzed, and used to build a detailed profile of you. This data is then used to serve targeted ads and influence your online experience. iBrowe Search, on the other hand, is designed with privacy as its core principle:
GoogleComparison.privacyConclusion: While Google offers a comprehensive search experience, it comes at the cost of your privacy. iBrowe Search provides a private alternative that doesn't track your searches or collect your personal data, while still delivering relevant search results.
GoogleComparison.featuresTitle: Does iBrowe Search have more features than Google?
GoogleComparison.featuresDescription: While Google offers a wide range of features, many of them are designed to collect more data about you. iBrowe Search focuses on providing essential search features while protecting your privacy.

FirefoxComparison.title: iBrowe vs Firefox
FirefoxComparison.subtitle: Firefox is known for its privacy features and open-source nature. While it's a good browser, iBrowe offers additional privacy protections and a more streamlined experience.
FirefoxComparison.privacyTitle: Is iBrowe more private than Firefox?
FirefoxComparison.privacyDescription: Firefox has a strong focus on privacy and is open-source, which is great. However, iBrowe takes privacy protection to the next level with additional features and a more comprehensive approach to user privacy:
FirefoxComparison.privacyConclusion: While Firefox is a solid choice for privacy-conscious users, iBrowe provides even stronger privacy protections and a more streamlined experience. Both browsers are good choices, but iBrowe offers more comprehensive privacy features.
FirefoxComparison.featuresTitle: Does iBrowe have more features than Firefox?
FirefoxComparison.featuresDescription: Both Firefox and iBrowe prioritize privacy, but iBrowe offers additional features that enhance your browsing experience while maintaining strong privacy protections.

faqs.question: What is iBrowe?
faqs.answer: iBrowe is a modern web browser designed to provide a faster, safer, and more efficient browsing experience. It combines powerful features with a user-friendly interface to enhance your online activities.

faqs.question: Is iBrowe free to use?
faqs.answer: Yes, iBrowe is completely free to download and use. We believe in providing a high-quality browsing experience without any cost to our users.

faqs.question: How is iBrowe different from other browsers?
faqs.answer: iBrowe stands out with its unique features like advanced privacy protection, faster page loading, smart search capabilities, and a user-friendly interface. We focus on providing a seamless browsing experience while prioritizing user privacy and security.

faqs.question: Can I import my bookmarks from other browsers?
faqs.answer: Yes, iBrowe allows you to easily import your bookmarks, history, and other data from popular browsers like Chrome, Firefox, and Edge. The import process is simple and straightforward.

faqs.question: Is iBrowe available for mobile devices?
faqs.answer: Currently, iBrowe is available for desktop platforms (Windows, macOS, and Linux). We are working on mobile versions and will announce their release soon.

faqs.question: How does iBrowe protect my privacy?
faqs.answer: iBrowe includes built-in privacy features such as ad blocking, tracker blocking, and secure browsing. We also don't collect or store your personal browsing data, ensuring your online activities remain private.

faqs.question: Can I customize iBrowe's appearance?
faqs.answer: Yes, iBrowe offers various customization options including themes, layouts, and toolbar configurations. You can personalize your browsing experience to match your preferences.

faqs.question: Does iBrowe support extensions?
faqs.answer: Yes, iBrowe supports a wide range of extensions and add-ons. You can enhance your browsing experience by installing extensions from our secure extension store.

faqs.question: How often is iBrowe updated?
faqs.answer: We regularly release updates to improve performance, add new features, and enhance security. Updates are automatic and can be installed with a single click.

faqs.question: How can I get support if I have issues?
faqs.answer: Our support team is available through multiple channels including email, live chat, and our community forum. We're committed to helping you resolve any issues quickly and efficiently.

SafariComparison.title: iBrowe vs Safari: Privacy-First Browser Comparison
SafariComparison.subtitle: Discover why iBrowe offers superior privacy protection compared to Safari
SafariComparison.privacyDescription: See how iBrowe's privacy features stack up against Safari's built-in protections
SafariComparison.privacyConclusion: While Safari offers basic privacy features, iBrowe provides comprehensive protection against tracking and data collection.
SafariComparison.featuresDescription: Compare the key features of iBrowe and Safari
SafariComparison.featuresComparison: Browe is built on the open-source Chromium engine the same one that powers Chrome, Edge, Opera, and Vivaldi. Safari, on the other hand, uses Apple's own open-source WebKit engine.Both browsers offer essential features like  bookmarks and tabs. But when it comes to extensions, Safari relies on the Apple App Store, with a limited selection. iBrowe supports a much broader range via the Chrome Web Store.
SafariComparison.footerNoteComparison: Some smaller features like translation and tab groups are available in both browsers. But to match iBrowe's full functionality, Safari requires multiple extensions. Unfortunately, that can introduce security risks and slow down your browsing experience. When it comes to overall capability, iBrowe outperforms Safari by a wide margin.

hero.title: iBrowe Browser Privacy Policy
hero.description: This Privacy Policy explains how iBrowe Software collects, uses, and protects information from users of the iBrowe browser. It reflects our commitment to privacy by design and ensures full compliance with global privacy regulations such as GDPR and CCPA.

overview.title: 1. Overview
overview.content: iBrowe is a browser designed to protect user privacy by default. It blocks tracking and unwanted ads, and this policy applies to the use of the iBrowe browser and related features such as iBrowe Shields and iBrowe Rewards. We aim to minimize personal data collection and rely on privacy-preserving mechanisms like on-device processing.

dataCollection.title: 2. Data We Collect
dataCollection.intro: iBrowe collects limited information, categorized as follows:

userInfo.title: Information Provided by Users:
userInfo.rewards: iBrowe Rewards: If you opt in to iBrowe Rewards (to view ads and earn iBrowe Attention Tokens or "iBOW"), you may be asked to provide information such as an email address for linking a crypto wallet.
userInfo.account: iBrowe Account: Email or subscription details (e.g., for iBrowe Premium).
userInfo.contact: Contacting iBrowe: Such as email content sent to our support team.

autoInfo.title: Automatically Collected Information:
autoInfo.usage: Usage Data: Anonymous data on how the browser functions, such as feature usage and button clicks.
autoInfo.statistics: Statistics: For example, the number of ads blocked by iBrowe Shields.
autoInfo.crash: Crash Reports: Only if you opt in, crash data is sent anonymously (no IP or personal info).
autoInfo.rewards: iBrowe Rewards and Ads: Ad interaction data is processed on-device. Tipping data is anonymized.

dataUse.title: 3. Purpose of Data Use
dataUse.content: To enhance browser performance and features, facilitate the operation of iBrowe Rewards and iBrowe Ads (e.g., managing BAT rewards), and conduct anonymized data analysis to support product development. We also use data to respond to user requests, such as providing customer support. iBrowe limits data collection to what is strictly necessary and avoids sharing personally identifiable information.

dataSharing.title: 4. Data Sharing
dataSharing.intro: iBrowe shares data only in limited and specific circumstances:
dataSharing.providers: Service Providers: We work with trusted partners who are contractually obligated to adhere to strict privacy and data protection standards.
dataSharing.legal: Legal Requirements: We may disclose data when required to comply with a valid legal process.
dataSharing.rewards: iBrowe Rewards: Certain information necessary for processing rewards may be shared with authorized partners.
dataSharing.noSell: iBrowe does not sell your personal information under any circumstances.

dataRetention.title: 5. Data Retention
dataRetention.content: We retain personal data only as long as needed to provide services. Anonymized data may be stored longer for analytics. Users may request deletion of their personal data at any time.

userRights.title: 6. User Rights
userRights.content: You may access, correct, delete, or transfer your data, and object to its processing under laws like GDPR and CCPA. EU users may contact their local authority. Reach us at

security.title: 7. Security
security.content: iBrowe uses security measures such as encryption and access controls. Most data is processed locally to reduce the risk of exposure.

privacyFeatures.title: 8. Privacy Features
privacyFeatures.content: iBrowe blocks ads and trackers, prevents third-party tracking, offers reward-based private ads, and supports anonymous browsing with Tor mode.

privacySettings.title: 9. Privacy Settings
privacySettings.content: Users can customize settings such as disabling anonymous usage metrics, adjusting iBrowe Shields (Standard or Aggressive), and more via Settings > Privacy and Security.

contact.title: 10. Contact
contact.content: For questions about this policy, contact us at

policyUpdates.title: 11. Policy Updates
policyUpdates.content: iBrowe may update this policy from time to time and will notify users via our website or other channels. The latest version takes effect upon publication.

privacyCommitment.title: Our Privacy Commitment
privacyCommitment.content: At iBrowe, our policy is not to collect personal data unless it is strictly necessary to provide our services or to comply with specific legal obligations. We do not buy or sell consumer personal information.

informed.title: 1. Right to Be Informed
informed.content: You have the right to know what personal data we collect, how we use it, and your associated rights.

access.title: 2. Right of Access
access.content: If we process your personal data, you may request a copy of that data.

erasure.title: 3. Right to Erasure
erasure.content: Under certain conditions, you may request that we delete your personal data.

rectification.title: 4. Right to Rectification
rectification.content: You may request that we correct inaccurate or incomplete personal data.

restrict.title: 5. Right to Restrict Processing
restrict.content: In certain situations, you may request that we suspend processing your data.

object.title: 6. Right to Object
object.content: In specific cases, you may object to our processing of your data.

portability.title: 7. Right to Data Portability
portability.content: Where applicable, you may request to receive your data in a structured, commonly used, machine-readable format.

ChromeComparison.title: iBrowe vs Chrome
ChromeComparison.subtitle: Discover why iBrowe is the only browser you'll ever need. Fast, private, effortless. iBrowe was built for users who demand more. We believe browsing should be smooth, secure, and free from hidden agendas. iBrowe isn't just a browser, it's your gateway to a faster, safer, and more independent internet experience. See the difference today. Experience browsing, redefined.
ChromeComparison.privacyTitle: Does iBrowe offer better privacy than Chrome?
ChromeComparison.privacyDescription: Google is a leading example of 'Big Tech' and one of the most valuable companies in the world. While many think of Google as a magical box, so influential it even inspired the verb 'to google' at its core, Google is an advertising company. The bulk of Google's multi-billion-dollar revenue comes from selling ads. To fuel this system, Chrome and Google Search are designed to collect as much information about you as possible. They then monetize this data by delivering highly targeted ads. The more they know about you, the more money they make.
ChromeComparison.privacyConclusion: In contrast, iBrowe shields you from tracking almost everywhere. Chrome was built with tracking in mind. It allows intrusive ads, trackers, cookies, and more to follow you across the web recording everything you do and often linking it directly to you, without your knowledge or consent. iBrowe, on the other hand, puts your privacy first by default.
ChromeComparison.featuresTitle: Does iBrowe offer more features than Chrome?
ChromeComparison.featuresDescription: Both iBrowe and Chrome are built on Chromium, the open-source browser engine that also powers Edge, Opera, and Vivaldi. As a result, they share a similar look and feel, along with core features like bookmarks and tab management. Any extension that works with Chrome will work with iBrowe too, although iBrowe comes packed with so many built-in features that you might not need extensions at all.
ChromeComparison.featuresComparison: Beyond these shared foundations, iBrowe offers a range of specially tailored features. When it comes to convenience and useful features, iBrowe is far ahead. To achieve the same level of functionality in Chrome, you'd need to install multiple extensions each one potentially slowing down performance and increasing security risks. There's no question: iBrowe wins hands down when it comes to built-in functionality.
ChromeComparison.footerNoteComparison:
When it comes to convenience and useful features, iBrowe is far ahead.
To achieve the same level of functionality in Chrome, you'd need to install multiple extensions â€” each one potentially slowing down performance and increasing security risks.
 There's no question: iBrowe wins hands down when it comes to built-in functionality.

wallet.title: iBrowe Wallet
wallet.subtitle: A secure built-in crypto wallet. Power up your browser and unlock the world of Web3 with no limits.
wallet.activate: Activate it in settings or simply click the wallet icon in your toolbar to get started.

simplify.title: Simplify crypto.
simplify.description: Manage your tokens and NFTs without switching between apps or extensions. All the power of a leading browser wallet built in, secure, and effortless.

explore.title: Explore the world of Web3
explore.description: Connect to DApps with iBrowe Wallet and unlock a whole new web experience. Join decentralized communities, buy and sell NFTs, explore DeFi, social platforms, and games and discover everything Web3 has to offer.

newWallet.title: A new kind of crypto wallet.
newWallet.description: Most crypto wallets rely on limited in-app browsers to access Web3 often compromising on performance, privacy, or security. iBrowe is different. It's not just a wallet. It's a fully private browser and a world-class crypto wallet built into one seamless experience. No trade-offs. No limits. Just full freedom to browse, transact, and connect with Web3 securely, privately, and effortlessly.

allInOne.title: Do more with your wallet. All in one place.
allInOne.description: No more switching apps or jumping between websites. Buy crypto instantly with your credit card, bank transfer, or other payment methods all within the same app. Fast, secure, and effortless. Real-time market insights. Stay on top of the crypto market with live prices, comparisons, and trending coin rankings powered by CoinGecko, trusted by investors worldwide. NFTs, beautifully organized. View and manage your NFTs across multiple blockchains including Ethereum, Polygon, and more in a single, elegant multichain gallery designed for simplicity and control.

easySetup.title: Easy to set up. Ready on every device.
easySetup.description: iBrowe Wallet works seamlessly across smartphones, tablets, and desktops. Whether it's your first crypto wallet or your fifth, creating a new account or importing an existing one takes just a few simple steps. Start using iBrowe Wallet instantly and connect to the world of Web3 with ease, security, and confidence on any device you choose.

procedure.title: Procedure for Reporting Copyright Infringement
procedure.signature: A physical or electronic signature of a person authorized to act on behalf of the copyright owner whose rights are allegedly infringed
procedure.identification: Identification of the copyrighted work or material claimed to have been infringed
procedure.location: Identification of the allegedly infringing content, including information reasonably sufficient to permit iBrowe to locate the material and verify its existence (e.g., URL or detailed location information)
procedure.contact: Contact information for the complaining party, including a physical address, telephone number, and, if available, an email address
procedure.statement: A statement that the complaining party has a good faith belief that the use of the material in the manner complained of is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law
procedure.accuracy: A statement, made under penalty of perjury, that the information in the notification is accurate and that the complaining party is authorized to act on behalf of the copyright owner

response.title: Upon Receipt of a Valid Infringement Notice
response.remove: Remove or disable access to the infringing content
response.notify: Notify the content provider, member, or user whose content has been removed or disabled
response.terminate: In the case of repeat offenders, remove the infringing content from the system and terminate access to the Services for the content provider, member, or user in question

counter.title: Procedure for Submitting a Counter-Notification
counter.signature: A physical or electronic signature of the content provider, member, or user
counter.identification: Identification of the content that was removed or to which access was disabled, and the location at which the content appeared before it was removed or disabled
counter.statement: A statement under good faith belief that the content was removed or disabled as a result of mistake or misidentification
counter.contact: The name, address, telephone number, and, if available, email address of the content provider, member, or user, along with a statement that such person or entity consents to the jurisdiction of the federal court located in the district of their address, or if the address is outside of Thailand, the courts in the jurisdiction where iBrowe is located, and that such person or entity will accept service of process from the person who submitted the original infringement notice

trackers.question: How Does iBrowe Block Trackers, Scripts, and Unwanted Resources?
trackers.answer:
ðŸ›¡ iBrowe Shields â€” Smart, Real-Time Privacy Protection

iBrowe Shields uses powerful filter lists and intelligent analysis to block threats and trackers automatically.

ðŸ“‹ Core Blocking Sources:
ðŸ”¹ EasyList & EasyPrivacy
â€“ The most widely-used filter lists for blocking ads and trackers across the web
ðŸ”¹ uBlock Origin Project
â€“ A respected open-source initiative known for its precise, customizable content blocking
ðŸ”¹ iBrowe's Custom Rulesets
â€“ Developed in-house to detect and block trackers that escape public filters, fine-tuned for real-world effectiveness

ðŸ§  Beyond Lists â€” Behavior-Based Protection
Some trackers may not appear in public blocklists.
That's why iBrowe also includes real-time behavioral analysis to detect and block scripts or code that exhibit tracking behavior even before public filters catch up.

ðŸ’ª Supporting the Privacy Community
iBrowe doesn't just use open-source blocklists we actively support, contribute to, and maintain these lists to help make the web safer for everyone.

âœ¨ The Result: Smarter, Deeper, and More Accurate Blocking
Compared to traditional browsers, iBrowe delivers protection that's:
â€“ More precise
â€“ More adaptive
â€“ And more committed to user-first privacy

fingerprinting.question: How Does Fingerprint Randomization Work?
fingerprinting.answer:
Every time you browse the web, your browser reveals certain unique details such as:
â€“ Your graphics hardware (GPU)
â€“ Audio hardware
â€“ Operating system
â€“ Language and installed fonts
â€“ Screen size
â€“ And browser version details

When combined, these values form a digital fingerprint which websites can use to track you across sites, even without cookies.

ðŸ” iBrowe Protects You with Fingerprint Randomization

By default, iBrowe Shields guards against fingerprinting using a combination of techniques:
âœ… Randomizing key identifiers used for tracking (e.g., WebGL, Canvas, AudioContext APIs)
âœ… Disabling or limiting access to fingerprintable information
âœ… Generating a fresh identity every time you restart or reopen the browser
âœ… Making your browser appear different to every website

ðŸš« The Result:
Websites can no longer link you across sessions or recognize your browser consistently over time.

ðŸ§ª Want to Test It?
Try Panopticlick by EFF to check how well your browser defends against fingerprinting.

âœ¨ iBrowe = Protection Even Where You Can't See It

storage.question: What Makes iBrowe's Third-Party Storage Blocking Different?
storage.answer:
Most privacy-focused browsers block third-party cookies, but iBrowe goes further, blocking all forms of third-party storage, including:

  • âœ… Third-party cookies
  • âœ… All third-party storage mechanisms, such as LocalStorage, IndexedDB, and other persistent storage inside <iframe>s or third-party scripts

ðŸ” What Sets iBrowe Apart: Ephemeral Storage

iBrowe Shields uses a concept called Ephemeral Partitioned Storage â€” a system that isolates and automatically erases third-party storage at the end of your session.

âœ¨ Here's How It Works:

  • Storage is partitioned away from the main site
  • Third-party data is temporary, lasting only while the tab or session is open
  • When the browser or tab is closed, all third-party storage is wiped clean

ðŸ›¡ï¸ The Result:

  • Trackers can't build long-term profiles or accumulate your data
  • Behavioral profiling is dramatically reduced
  • Even if a tracker slips past blocklists, structural protections remain in place

âœ¨ iBrowe = Privacy Beyond Blocking
Not just filters, but deep, architectural defenses that stop unwanted tracking at the source.

disable.question: One of the Websites I Visit Isn't Working â€” Can I Turn Off iBrowe Shields?
disable.answer:
The answer is: Yes but with caution.

When you disable iBrowe Shields, your privacy protections for that specific site are temporarily turned off. This means:
â€“ Trackers may be loaded
â€“ Cross-site cookies may become active
â€“ Third-party scripts could run normally again

âœ… If You Need to Turn Off Shields:
- Make sure the site is trustworthy
- Click the iBrowe Shields icon ðŸ›¡ï¸ in the address bar
- Toggle the switch to "Disable Shields for this site"

If the site works as expected after Shields are disabled, you can also click "Report Site Issue" to notify the iBrowe team.
We'll review it and improve compatibility in future updates.

â„¹ï¸ Note:
Disabling Shields affects only that site.
Other tabs and websites remain fully protected by iBrowe Shields.

ðŸ›¡ï¸ iBrowe gives you control without sacrificing safety.

modes.question: What's the Difference Between Standard and Aggressive Mode in iBrowe Shields?
modes.answer:
iBrowe Shields offers two main protection modes, so you can choose the level of privacy that fits your needs:

ðŸ”° Standard Mode (Default)
This is the default setting, designed for balanced protection.
â€“ Blocks common ads, trackers, and privacy-invasive scripts
â€“ Maintains full compatibility with most websites
â€“ Ideal for everyday users who want privacy without breaking site functionality

ðŸ‘ Best for: General users who want seamless browsing with solid protection

ðŸ”’ Aggressive Mode
This mode adds stronger protection, including:
â€“ Blocking third-party scripts and advanced tracking resources
â€“ May cause some websites to load improperly or break certain features

ðŸ’¡ While iBrowe attempts to preserve site functionality, some visual or functional disruptions may occur.

ðŸ” Best for: Users who prioritize maximum privacy and don't mind occasional display issues

âœ¨ Switching Modes is Easy:
Go to: Settings > iBrowe Shields > Protection Level
Then choose the mode that matches your personal privacy style.

translation.question: Would You Like to Use iBrowe for Translation?
translation.answer: iBrowe Browser now offers a built-in translation feature for both desktop and Android users (iOS support is coming in future updates) iBrowe has partnered with Lingvanex to deliver fast, seamless translation services making it easier than ever to browse content in multiple languages.

tor.question: Private Browsing with Tor
tor.answer: In "Private Window with Tor" mode, iBrowe Browser routes your connection through three layers of volunteer-run servers in the Tor network, instead of connecting directly to websites. This multi-layered approach enhances your privacy and anonymity while you browse.

sync.question: How to Set Up Sync
sync.answer: Sync lets you effortlessly connect and synchronize your browsing data across multiple devices using iBrowe. With just a few steps, you can keep your bookmarks, passwords, browsing history, and settings perfectly aligned across your desktop, mobile, and beyond making your browsing experience smoother, faster, and more personalized.

installation.title: Install iBrowe on Linux
installation.systemRequirements: System Requirements: 64-bit Linux distribution with glibc 2.28 or later
installation.signingKeys: Signing Keys: All packages are signed with our GPG key. You can verify the signatures using our public key.

channels.releaseDescription: The stable release channel is recommended for most users. It receives regular updates with bug fixes and security patches.
channels.betaDescription: The beta channel is for users who want to test new features before they are released to the stable channel. It may contain bugs and is not recommended for production use.
channels.nightlyDescription: The nightly channel contains the latest development builds. It is updated daily and may be unstable. Only use this if you want to test the latest features and don't mind potential issues.

installation.aurHelper: Using an AUR helper like yay:
installation.flatpakDescription: Flatpak is a universal package format that works on any Linux distribution. It provides a sandboxed environment for applications.
installation.snapDescription: Snap is a universal package format that works on any Linux distribution. It provides automatic updates and rollback capabilities.
installation.githubDescription: You can download the latest release directly from our GitHub repository. This is useful if you want to install iBrowe on an unsupported distribution.
installation.unofficialDescription: These distributions are not officially supported by iBrowe, but community members maintain packages for them. While we don't provide direct support, these packages are generally well-maintained and reliable.

troubleshooting.title: Common Issues and Solutions
troubleshooting.description: If you encounter any issues during installation or while using iBrowe, try these solutions:
troubleshooting.commands:
# Update your system first
sudo apt update && sudo apt upgrade  # For Debian/Ubuntu
sudo dnf update  # For Fedora
sudo zypper update  # For openSUSE
sudo pacman -Syu  # For Arch Linux

# If the package manager reports errors, try:
sudo apt clean && sudo apt update  # For Debian/Ubuntu
sudo dnf clean all && sudo dnf update  # For Fedora
sudo zypper clean && sudo zypper update  # For openSUSE
sudo pacman -Scc && sudo pacman -Syu  # For Arch Linux
